intro: Hedera echinops, commonly known as the spiny ivy, is a climbing plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers followed by dark blue berries. Its leaves are often covered in tiny spines, giving it its common name. Hedera echinops is typically found in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and rocky areas.
